fullText: When Bess Wohl’s “Liberation” opened Off Broadway all the way back in February, it would have been ridiculous to grace it with best-of superlatives. Now that “Liberation” has opened on Broadway this Tuesday at the James Earl Jones Theatre, it’s entirely apt to write that it’s the year’s best play. There are only a few other new plays to open in 2025 and I’ve seen most of them in previews. Bank on it: “Liberation” remains the best.

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Critic explicitly calls it 'the year's best play' and doubles down with 'Bank on it' - clear superlative language indicating unqualified enthusiasm. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses unqualified enthusiasm and declares the play as the best of the year, indicating a strong recommendation.
